## Description

Provide a summary of the changes and the **related JIRA stories**. Include relevant context for both backend and frontend (UI) changes. Highlight any manual configurations and mention updates made to **alarms**, **dashboards**, and **logs**.

---

## Related JIRA Stories

Reference all related JIRA tickets for traceability:
- [ ] JIRA Story 1: [JIRA Ticket #](link)
- [ ] JIRA Story 2: [JIRA Ticket #](link)

---

## UI/Frontend Changes

If the changes involve updates to the UI, please include the following:

### Visual/Design Changes:
- [ ] **Screenshots** or **Mockups**: Provide before/after screenshots or link to design mockups.
- [ ] **Design System**: Ensure adherence to the project's design system (e.g., consistent with buttons, colors, typography, etc.).

### UI Components Modified:
- [ ] **New/Updated Components**: List any components that were created or modified.
- [ ] **Responsive Design**: Verify that the changes work across different screen sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop).
- [ ] **Cross-browser Compatibility**: Ensure the changes are tested across multiple browsers (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Safari).
- [ ] **Accessibility (a11y)**: Ensure accessibility compliance (ARIA roles, keyboard navigation, etc.).

### Frontend Testing:
- [ ] **UI Tests**: Include tests for frontend components using frameworks like Jest, Cypress, etc.
- [ ] **End-to-End Testing**: Ensure that the changes have been tested with user flows in mind (if applicable).

---

## Manual Changes

Provide details of any **manual changes** made, such as configuration updates or operational adjustments. Ensure these are recorded in the appropriate documentation or repository.

- [ ] All manual changes have been documented.

---

## Alarms and Dashboards

- [ ] **Alarms** have been added or updated for monitoring key metrics.
- [ ] **Dashboards** have been created or updated to provide visibility into system health.

---

## Testing

### Backend Testing:

- **Test Configuration**: Detail the environment and tools used for testing.
- **How to Reproduce**: Provide clear steps for others to reproduce the testing.

Include tests run locally:
- [ ] Test A: Describe test and result.
- [ ] Test B: Describe test and result.

### Frontend/UI Testing:

- [ ] **Cross-browser Tests**: List any browsers and versions tested.
- [ ] **Responsiveness Tests**: Mention different screen sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop) tested.
- [ ] **Accessibility Tests**: Confirm that accessibility requirements were met (keyboard, screen reader support, etc.).

---

## Logs and Comments

- [ ] Logs have been updated to reflect the new changes.
- [ ] Comments have been added where needed, particularly in complex or hard-to-understand areas.
- [ ] Error handling has been improved, and logs are now more informative for debugging.

---

## Checklist

- [ ] My code follows the project style guidelines.
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my code.
- [ ] I have commented on my code, especially in hard-to-understand areas.
- [ ] Corresponding documentation has been updated.
- [ ] No new warnings are generated by my changes.
- [ ] I have added relevant tests to prove my fix or feature works.
- [ ] All unit tests pass locally.
- [ ] Alarms and dashboards have been set up and documented.
- [ ] All manual changes are logged and reviewed.
- [ ] All dependent changes have been merged and published.
- [ ] UI/Frontend changes follow design guidelines, are responsive, and have passed cross-browser and accessibility tests.
